Description: Bowl and tondo sherd of Attic pottery Droop cup; interior glazed save for tondo, reserved as far as preserved; exterior: alternating bands of red and black separated by sets of four lines; at base, void and filled rays emerging from set of four lines.
Curator's comments: The reserved rays are unusual for the shape and more common on cups of type A; compare, however, a Droop cup from Xanthus in Istanbul, Archaeological Museum: A15.1197 (ABV 689.5TER), attributed to the Group of Rhodes 12264, and a fragment of a cup from the Samian Heraion: Kreuzer, B. Die attisch scharzfigurige Keramik aus dem Heraion von Samos, (Samos XXII). Mainz 1998, 201, no. 374, pl. 52.374 (identified there as an Attic eye cup, i.e. cup type A). For parallels, see Reading 26.2.2.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0597) (Phase 1)
